page.title: 12Abbotsley Church.
page.content: Abbotsley church started its life in 1138, and is dedicated to St Margaret of Antioch.There are 4 kings on the corners of the parapet on the tower. These figures are about 16th century and are supposed to be Macbeth, Malcolm, Harold and William, and people say,that two of the kings heads fell off and the men put them on the wrong bodies. There are five bells in the tower and out of the five, two are in working order.The church has been restored by the redundant church commissioners. So now we use only part of it for services every Sunday,but if it is an important service then we ask permission and can use the nave as well.The church is surrounded by a churchyard which has some old graves dating back to around about the 1630's. (continued on page 13)
